Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 05:36PM TXGigi wrote: I have been on Xeloda for two years.  7 days on, 7 off, 3,000 mils a day.  My main problem is that I tire very easily.  I AM ALWAYS TIRED.  Had issues with the feet right off the bat but now my hands hurt.  They feel brittle and hard to make a fist.  I lather feet and hands at night. Just recently had a pet scan and I was told there was major improvement so onc is keeping me on these meds. Good Luck.
Posts.Title: Xeloda - Your Side Effects and What You Do To Alleviate Them NMM lsacrowe

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 07:09PM TXGigi wrote: I have been on Xeloda for 19 months.  The SE's get to me at times but they aren't too bad.  I have watery eyes, my feet are peeling.  My hands hurt in the cracks.  I use utter cream daily.  So far it is keeping it manageable and I do still get mani/pedi.  I just make sure they don't scrub the bottom of my feet cause it hurts like hell the day after.  I do get diareaha about once a week but nothing that I have to take immodium for unless I am going out and don't want to take the chance of getting it while in the store, etc.  Most of my worries are just in my head.  The fear of ---- The only advice I have is to start using the utter cream right away.  I waited until I had peeling feet.  I am sure if I had used it from the beginning the peeling would not be as bad as I let it get.

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 03:20PM - edited May 10, 2011 03:21PM by TXGigi I was on Taxol and Avastin.  My hair fell out after my 4th treatment of Taxol.  All at once.  The Avastin (which I am still on) caused nose bleeds and crud in my nose that I won't even talk about.  I was taken off Taxol after my 16th treatment because of Nurapathy in the feet.  My feet swelled and I had horrible pains in my toes.  The Avastin gave me high blood pressure that I now take meds for. We are all different, I am just saying what happened to me.  All I can say is Taxol was harsh on my body but it did its job and that is all that counts. Good Luck!  PS  I see you are in Magnolia.  I am in Conroe and get my infusions at the Woodlands.

Posts.Content: TXGigi wrote: I am currently taking Avastin, Zometa and Xeloda.  Today I have a pain in my right leg.  Sort of like a muscle cramp, goes down whole leg.  I generally take pedialite when I get normal cramps in my legs, hands, etc.  I just took some but it is not working. Could this be a side effect?  I have bone mets to the spine.  Today I feel good.  No back ache just this friggin cramp down my leg.  Sitting here crying and feeling sorry for myself. My husband is out in the yard.  I have to hide my crying.  I do it so much and I know it upsets him. A lot of the side effects for Xeloda say "if you are 80 or older".  What a friggin joke.  I am 62 and feel like I am 80 so what the heck is the difference. Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 06:22PM TXGigi wrote: I was in the chemo room having my Taxol.  There were a few people in there who were very sick.  One just had a bad reaction to the chemo and a man was in there freezing because of a reaction to the chemo. When the infusion nurse left to go into the "mixing" room I heard her say "All those people out there have a problem today".  I swear if I was not hooked up I would of went in there and told her off.  A problem?????  You bitch. My next infusion she came up to me real cheery and said " Hi, Mrs. Cougot how are you today?"  I said very coldly "Just fine".  I never had any use for her after I heard that comment.

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2015 12:31PM TXGigi wrote: I was diagnosed in 2009.  Started with avastin, taxol and someta.  Was taken off taxol because of neurapathy and also had a huge whole in my shin bone that would not heal.  I was put on xeloda which lasted 3 1/2 years.  Then on to gemzar, abraxane and doxil.  Now on halvalen which is working really well.  My biggest problem is my jaw bone.  Seems either the zometa and xgeva has given me ONJ.  I am still on xgeva every other month.  Onc says the benefits of xgeva outweigh the ONJ since I already have the disease. I never expected to live this long - 5 1/2 years.  If I did I would of lived my life different.  I would of lived it instead of worrying about it every single day and never enjoying my life.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 01:56AM TXGigi wrote: I was on Taxol, every week for 5 months.  I did loose my sense of taste but I can't say I had the metallic taste.  I asked the onc nurse and she said to quirt lemon juice on my food.  I can say that I could taste sweet food, nothing else.  So I ate lots of sweets. Doctor took me off Taxol.   I had a sore on my leg that looked like a spider was eating it.  It was gross.  I also had a rash on my ring finger for months.   I thought I was allergic to my wedding ring after 29 years.  It all disappeared when I went off Taxol.  Still have slight neuraphy but it is doable. Taxol worked miracles.  I hope it does the same for you.
